          <title>
            <string language="nl">Lorentz force</string>
          </title>
          <language>nl</language>
          <description>
            <string language="lt"> 
The Lotentz force is the force on a point charge due to elektromagnetic fields.
In many cases of practical interest, the motion in a magnetic field of an electrically charged particle (such as an electron or ion in a plasma) can be treated as the superposition of a  relatively fast circular motion around a point called the guiding  center and a relatively slow drift of this point. The drift  speeds may differ for various species depending on their charge states,  masses, or temperatures, possibly resulting in electric currents or  chemical separation.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>

          </keyword>
